ygData.subject: Re: Buying and Selling Songs
ygData.msgSnippet: Simple solution for the cannot be dropped or traded thing.  I learned this after a friend traded for the journey boots (another cannot be dropped, etc.,
ygData.messageBody:
Simple solution for the "cannot be dropped or traded" thing. I learned this
after a friend traded for the journey boots (another cannot be dropped,
etc., item). Put the lore item in a pack and then trade the pack with the
lore item in it.



>From: "Kyle" <ksibbald@...>
>
> A lore item only checks to see if you have another instance in your
>inventory. When you scribe the song it is no longer a scroll so, yes, you
>could buy-scribe-buy. You might have problems getting rid of the second
one,
>though, since lore items cannot be dropped or traded.
>
> Good Journey,
>
> Sineras Silverlyre (Cazic-Thule)
>
>-----Original Message-----
>From: Douglas Bierbower [mailto:Bierbower@...]
>Sent: Friday, May 14, 1999 12:32 PM
>To: eqbards@onelist.com
>Subject: [eqbards] Buying and Selling Songs
>
>
>From: Douglas Bierbower <Bierbower@...>
>
>I also got burned by the one lore item limitation. I tried to buy two
>copies of
>two songs in Kelthin and paid for all four but only ended up with one copy
>of
>each. I petitioned and was told, in essence, tough luck. Thanks for the
>great
>documentation Verant. It appears that this has been corrected a little. I
>put
>a copy of a song in the bank and tried to purchase another copy and it
would
>not
>sell it to me. Good work Verant. I still want my platinum back.
>
>I do not know if I can buy a song that I have already scribed. Has anyone
>tried
>that?
>
>Narcissus of Povar, Bard of the 17th Song
>
>
>
>
